intro: Cnidium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading cnidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small white flowers. The plant has slender, branched stems that often grow close to the ground, with pinnately divided leaves. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Cnidium diffusum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
